intro: Pilosella puenteana, commonly known as the Puentean hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are yellow and borne in clusters. Pilosella puenteana is often found in regions with temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
